Borussia Dortmund are 'ready to walk away' from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang talks due to their anger at Arsenal's negotiating tactics. (Source: Daily Mirror)

OZIL’S FUTURE

Mesut Ozil is yet to commit his future to Arsenal with his current deal set to expire at the end of the season.

Here’s what Arsene Wenger has had to say about his future…

“Our intention is to keep Ozil at the club,” the Frenchman said. “Hopefully, we will manage to do that very soon. It’s not close enough to be optimistic but not far enough to be pessimistic.

When asked if negotiations are progressing, he added: “ The vibe I get from his commitment, focus and desire, he behaves like someone who is ready to commit. After that, contract negotiations are what they are. We aren’t close enough to tell you yes, he will stay.”

筆錢留黎比臭燒算啦
唔想見到卡叔行都行唔到

之前有排勁凍我就同佢去泰國玩+避寒，咁我地兩個去到都多數只係用簡單英文溝通，叫野食都係用"this" "this"咁，都應付到

但有一次搭緊車既時候，突然間有兩個唔知邊到既遊客聊我傾計，咁我英文差聽唔明，就叫男友幫拖囉，點知佢都聽唔明，只係識不斷講ok thank you ，而果兩個遊客好似知道我地聽唔明咁，兩個對視之後係到大聲笑 ，搞到我尷尬，唉，真係好失禮…

遲d點帶佢去d高級餐廳,見我d姊妹?
有冇絲打bf都係咁? 點解決?

雲加澄清：冇寸過熱刺！

【now.com體育】阿仙奴主帥雲加日前被指，暗寸熱刺多年無冠，引來熱刺領隊普捷天奴反擊。雲加在周五賽前記者會就澄清自己的言論。

「我只是在投訴己隊經常都被傳媒針對，我沒有暗寸熱刺，只是說出一個例子。我在這裡工作了20年，一直尊重傳媒，但不能接受被質問一些我根本沒有說過的事。」對於普帥的反擊，雲加（Arsene Wenger）大方地表示：「他只是被誤導。」

阿仙奴在周二英超將作客史雲斯，雲加透露還未決定會否讓新加盟的米希達利恩作出處子戰：「他可以踢中場在防守以外的所有位置，雖然通常都被安排踢翼或攻中，但其實box-to-box也能勝任。」

對於有傳射手基奧特要求離隊，而車路士有意接手，雲加否認真有其事：「他沒有說要走，我們一直都有交流，而且他踢了很多比賽，亦攻入很多重要入球，是重要的資產。他只會在有人加盟時離開。」

有權參與開發當地的石油、礦物資源，並利用北極航道。

外交部就反駁指，這些擔心完全沒有必要。

replies.msg:
唉唔係想負面不過個個 media 而家都 suggest the deal may be off
同埋阿狗寧願 fail 都唔肯比多蒙特個 asking price

SUMMARY:

KICKER: Let’s Kicker off (hahahaha) with news from the German daily. They report that negotiations between Arsenal and Dortmund over Aubameyang are ‘threatening to burst’ and ‘have now stalled’. That doesn’t sound too good. And Dortmund ‘are increasingly angry’ with Arsenal for essentially p*ssing about. The talks have been too ‘slow’, and the German side are losing patience.

Dortmund value Aubameyang at around £61.3m, but Arsenal’s first offer was only of £43.8m, with £4.3m in add-ons. Their second bid was ‘only marginally’ higher, which does sound an awful lot like Arsenal. It has left Dortmund ‘not pleased’ with the Gunners, who are being accused of ‘stalling tactics’.

In a further blow to the deal, Dortmund are only willing to part with £1.3m in a loan fee for Olivier Giroud. It all combines for one result: ‘An agreement is currently more questionable than ever.’



BILD: The German newspaper leads off on something of a controversy brewing in the country, and Kicker are involved again. One of their journalists was criticised for describing Aubameyang’s recent behaviour as a ‘monkey circus’ last week, which obviously brings with it unnecessary connotations. It may have been intended as ‘monkey business’, or another phrase to point out the ‘crazy’ nature of the situation, but still.

Aubameyang responded on Instagram, as did his father. The latter, Pierre Senior, accused the journalist of trying to ‘bring us back to the Hitler era’. Oh my.

The Kicker journalist has apologised and Aubameyang’s father has since deleted his comment, but a week on, Bild are still headlining their front page with the ‘Hitler’ stuff. They are not happy with Aubameyang’s father. Strong work. Sport Witness break the whole thing down much better.

Bild’s headline news on Friday accuses Aubameyang’s father – also his agent, just to clarify – of playing ‘tricks’. He is the ‘puppet-master’, the man solely responsible for the striker’s ‘change of heart’. ‘‘The head of the family is the driving force behind the transfer to Arsenal,’ they say. It’s all a bit murky.



DAILY STAR: A Paul Brown (us neither) exclusive brings us the massive news that Arsenal will have to break their club-record transfer fee to sign Aubameyang. We’re pretty sure everyone accepted this as fact anyway.

One piece of interesting information comes halfway through their article, however. It is claimed that Arsenal ‘are willing to let it go down right down to the wire’ in the hope of bringing Dortmund’s demands down. That is an absolutely genius plan; it absolutely will not work.



DAILY MAIL: The stuff about Giroud is interesting. A number of British outlets report that talks have broken down between Dortmund and Arsenal over the Frenchman. Let’s look at what the Daily Mail are saying.

Talks have ‘hit an impasse’ over Giroud, who is now ‘assessing other options’. Aubameyang is still trying to push his move to Arsenal through regardless, and so Dortmund are considering a move for Michy Batshuayi as his replacement.
